intro: Libanotis stephaniana, commonly known as the Armenian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia and Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
